com.github.situx.postagger.main.gui.ime

Class JPagedChooser<V,S>

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • com.github.situx.postagger.main.gui.ime.JPagedChooser<V,S>
  • Type Parameters:
    V - the parameterized type of value contained in the chooser
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable

    public class JPagedChooser<V,S>
extends javax.swing.JComponent
    A Swing component listing numbered options that can be selected from. One option is can be highlighted as selected, and the items can be scrolled through, item by item, with paging. Can be oriented horizontally or vertically as defined in the constructors. Originally built to render below-the-spot options for an input method, but may have other applications.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • JPagedChooser

        public JPagedChooser(java.util.List<Tuple<InputTerm<V>,java.lang.String>> options,
                     boolean horizontal,
                     boolean showIndices,
                     int itemsPerPage)
        Build a new JPagedChooser.
        Parameters:
        options - the options
        horizontal - true if should be oriented horizontally, false for vertically
        showIndices - true if numbered indices should be shown, false otherwise
        itemsPerPage - number of items to show on one page

    • Method Detail

      • nextPage

        public boolean nextPage()
        Advance the pager to the next page, if there is a next page.
        Returns:
        true if the page was advanced, false if there wasn't a next page

      • nextItem

        public boolean nextItem()
        Advance the selection cursor to the next item. If on the last item of a page, the page will be advanced and the first item of the next page is selected.
        Returns:
        true if advanced to the next page, false if there was no next item

      • previousPage

        public boolean previousPage()
        Move back to the previous page.
        Returns:
        true if able to move to the previous page, false if already on it

      • previousItem

        public boolean previousItem()
        Move the selection cursor back to the prior item, if not already on the first item.
        Returns:
        if moved back to the previous item, false if already on the first

      • getValue

        public InputTerm<V> getValue(int index)
        Get the value at the given index, indexed from 0. Note that if you are showing indices, the first item is displayed as item 1, but is stored at 0...
        Parameters:
        index - the item index
        Returns:
        the value for the index
